channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Wales moves to alert level zero with most rules scrapped
item.description: Social distancing ends, but face masks are still needed in shops and on public transport.

item.title: Covid: Students in Wales able to enjoy first night out in 18 months
item.description: Nightclubs in Wales are finally able to reopen their doors - but people are urged to be sensible.

item.title: Logan Mwangi: Three in court over boy's river death
item.description: Logan Mwangi's step-dad is charged with murder and his mother with perverting the course of justice.

item.title: Covid: How will we adjust to life without so many rules?
item.description: With Wales moving into alert level zero, an expert says behaviours learnt in the pandemic might last.

item.title: Family tribute to 'blue-eyed boy' killed on Carmarthenshire farm
item.description: Police say three-year-old Ianto Sior Jenkins died after he was hit by a vehicle on the farm.

item.title: Thunderstorm weather warning for Wales on Saturday
item.description: Heavy rain could cause some flooding and travel disruption on Saturday, the Met Office says.

item.title: Llanelli: Man, 56, dies after falling from e-scooter
item.description: No other vehicles were involved and the man died at the scene, police say.

item.title: Charge delays slammed as St Asaph man's body 'deteriorates'
item.description: A coroner is concerned prosecutors' "tardiness" means a man's body remains in a mortuary.

item.title: Tree-planting: Why are large investment firms buying Welsh farms?
item.description: Plans to encourage more tree-planting are under fire for "destroying" rural communities.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Price to fight for gold after beating Nouchka Fontijn
item.description: Great Britain boxer Lauren Price will fight for a gold medal on the final day of Tokyo 2020 after winning her women's middleweight semi-final.

item.title: Covid anti-vaxxers: 'Shut down fake news sites,' begs daughter
item.description: The woman says her parents have been fooled by conspiracy theories about Covid online.

item.title: Covid: Excitement as nightclubs reopen in Wales
item.description: Most of Wales' remaining Covid rules are lifted as nightclubs reopen in alert level zero.

item.title: Covid: Hospitality rules change after '18 months of hell'
item.description: Two-metre distancing and masks will not be legally required in pubs and restaurants from Saturday.

item.title: Covid: Live music in Wales resumes with Feeder gig
item.description: Despite outdoor restrictions being relaxed weeks ago, the venue is still taking precautions.

item.title: Covid: First minister outlines end of most restrictions
item.description: Wales is "on the final lap of emerging from the pandemic", Mark Drakeford says.

item.title: Covid lockdown easing: What are people looking forward to in Wales?
item.description: As most restrictions end in Wales on Saturday, weddings, events and socialising are back.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Price 'over the moon' to reach gold-medal fight
item.description: Great Britain boxer Lauren Price says she is "over the moon" to reach Sunday's middleweight final.

item.title: British and Irish Lions v South Africa has 'huge implications', says Ronan O'Gara
item.description: The British and Irish Lions' decisive third Test in South Africa "has huge implications for the future of rugby", says three-time tourist Ronan O'Gara.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: Alun Wyn Jones set to equal fellow Welshman Graham Price's Lions caps record
item.description: Former Wales prop Graham Price says he is happy with Alun Wyn Jones sharing his British and Irish Lions Welsh record of 12 Test appearances.

item.title: Julian Winter: Swansea City chief promises more investment from American owners
item.description: Swansea City chief executive Julian Winter says the club's American owners will invest more into the Championship club this year.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Daley wins diving bronze after boxer Galal Yafai claims Olympic gold
item.description: Tom Daley claims bronze in the men's 10m platform after boxer Galal Yafai wins Team GB's first boxing gold in Tokyo to become Olympic flyweight champion.

item.title: Russell Martin: New Swansea City boss on playing style, record goals and beaches
item.description: New head coach Russell Martin hopes to take Swansea City back to the future with his progressive playing style.

item.title: Llacio cyfyngiadau wrth i Gymru symud i lefel sero
item.description: Y rhan fwyaf o gyfyngiadau bellach wedi'u llacio wrth i Gymru symud i lefel rhybudd sero.

item.title: 'Ry'n am i dorfeydd heidio i Dregaron yn 2022'
item.description: Ar ddiwedd wythnos Eisteddfod AmGen pobl Ceredigion yn paratoi i godi momentwm ar gyfer 2022.

item.title: Gwasanaeth bysiau hyblyg i Ben Llŷn
item.description: Mae teithwyr bysiau 'fflecsi' yn gallu dewis pryd a lle maent yn dymuno mynd a dod.

item.title: 20 mlynedd ers i ferch gipio'r Gadair am y tro cyntaf
item.description: Mererid Hopwood yn cofio ei chadeirio yn Eisteddfod Genedlaethol Dinbych 2001.

item.title: Y Llewod i ruo am y tro olaf yn Ne Affrica
item.description: Gêm brawf dyngedfennol yn erbyn y Springboks yn wynebu tîm Warren Gatland.
